subtitle: A beautiful cheesecake with an interesting combination of flavours.

method.text: Lightly grease a 20 cm spring-clip cake tin (with a side lock), or cake tin with a loose base.
Blend the biscuit crumbs with the melted butter or margarine and sugar. Press into the base and up the sides of the tin until smooth. Chill.
Mix the raisins with the coffee liqueur and leave to macerate.
Dissolve the coffee powder in the boiling water. Allow to cool slightly then blend with the sugar. Leave to cool.
Beat the coffee into the cheese. Add the cream. Beat together until smooth.
Blend the egg yolks and soaked raisins with any coffee liqueur left. Mix into the cheese mixture.

Whisk the egg whites until they stand in soft peaks. Whisk 1 or 2 tablepoons into the cheese mixture, to give a softer consistency. Fold in the remainder of the whisked egg whites using a large metal spoon.
Spoon into the prepared tin and bake in the oven for 60-90 min, or until firm to the touch.
Allow to cool in the oven with the heat turned off (in an electric oven, leave the oven door open). This stops the cake from wrinkling on top.

When completely cooled, transfer to a serving dish. Spread a little of the jam over the top of the cake, then arrange the grapes in a neat design. Carefully brush with the rest of the warmed jam and leave to cool. Serve in slices.

title: Coffee and grape cheesecake
